intro: Cloezia artensis var. basilaris, commonly known as the Basilar cloezia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive basal rosette of broad, velvety leaves that form a dense cluster near the ground. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
